It was founded in 1905 and was originally named Fudan Public School. In 1917, it was named Fudan University and was the first higher education institution independently founded by the Chinese people. The predecessor of Shanghai Medical University was the National Fourth Sun Yat sen University School of Medicine founded in 1927. In 2000, Fudan University merged with Shanghai Medical University. At present, the school has 12 disciplines including philosophy, economics, law, education, literature, history, science, engineering, medicine, management, art, and interdisciplinary subjects; In 2021, 20 disciplines of the school were selected for the second round of "Double First Class" construction, an increase of 3 selected disciplines compared to the first round.

There are 3602 teaching and research personnel on campus.
